content:
Intent: Join Hogwarts house
Slot1: "identify houses" possible values: [Gryffindor, Ravenclaw, Hufflepuff, Slytherin]
Slot2: "identify Gryffindor house values" possible values: [bravery, heroism]
Slot3: "Identify Ravenclaw house values" possible values: [intelligence, cleverness]
Slot4: "Identify Hufflepuff house values" possible values: [loyalty, strong worth ethic]
Slot5: "Identify Slytherin house values" possible values: [ambition, power]

Intent: Identify house mates
Slot1: "Gryffindors" some examples: [Harry Potter, Hermione Granger, Ron Weasley, Neville Longbottom, Dean Thomas, Ginny Weasley, Seamus Finnegan, Oliver Wood]
Slot 2: "Ravenclaws" some examples: [Cho Chang, Luna Lovegood, Roger Davies, Padma Patil, Terry Boot, Penelope Clearwater
Slot3: "Hufflepuffs" some examples: [Hannah Abbott, Ernie MacMillan, Susan Bones, Justin Finch-Fletchley, Cedric Diggory]
Slot4: "Slytherins" some examples: [Draco Malfoy, Pansy Parkinson, Blaise Zabini, Vincent Crabbe, Gregory Goyle, Theodore Nott, Millicent Bulstrode]

Intent: Identify Magical Creatures
Slot1: "magical creatures" some examples: [unicorn, nifflers, hippogriffs, dragons, hinkypunks, boggart, dementor, bowtruckle, grindlylow, phoenix, pixy, red cap]

Intent: Attend classes
Slot1: "subjects" possible examples: [transfiguration, divination, potions, charms, herbology, care of magical creatures, defense against the dark arts, magical history, astronomy]

Instructions: You are a student attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Respond to the following utterance from this perspective.
You are a student at Hogwarts and a member of house Ravenclaw.  If you stick with your own house, who are some of the other students you spend time with, outside of classes?

chosen:
As a member of House Ravenclaw, there are several students you may interact with outside of class:

    Cho Chang - Cho is a popular girl in Ravenclaw known for her skills in Charms. She was also a seeker on the school's Quidditch team.
    Luna Lovegood - Luna is an eccentric but kind-hearted Ravenclaw known for her unique fashion sense and interest in unusual phenomena.
    Roger Davies - Roger is a talented athlete and one of the prefects in Ravenclaw. He often helps new students navigate their way around Hogwarts.
    Padma Patil - Padma is intelligent and level-headed, and she serves as President of the Dumbledore's Army club in later years.
    Terry Boot - Terry is a friendly and outgoing Ravenclaw who enjoys playing pranks on his friends (though they usually get him back even worse!).
    Penelope Clearwater - Penelope is a quiet and studious Ravenclaw who excels in her studies and often helps others understand difficult concepts.

These are just a few examples of the many fascinating characters you might encounter as part of House Ravenclaw. Remember that friendships can be formed across houses, so don't hesitate to reach out and make connections with people you meet along the way!
rejected:
As a member of House Ravenclaw, there are several other students you might spend time with during your free hours. While each house has its own common room and dining hall, students often intermingle in various locations throughout the castle and grounds. Here are some potential classmates you may encounter:

From Gryffindor House - Although friendships across houses do happen, interactions between Ravenclaws and Gryffindors can be limited due to different common rooms and schedules. However, if you participate in shared activities like Quidditch or study groups, you could get to know people like Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Hermione Granger, or Ginny Weasley.

From Hufflepuff House - Since both Hufflepuffs and Ravenclaws value loyalty and hard work, you're likely to have more opportunities to bond with these students. Some potential friends include Hannah Abbott, Ernie Macmillan, Susan Bones, and Cedric Diggory.

From Slytherin House - Interactions with Slytherins can be less frequent as their priorities sometimes clash with those of Ravenclaws. Still, you might meet Draco Malfoy, Pansy Parkinson, or Blaise Zabini if you find yourself in shared spaces like the Great Hall or the library.

Other Students - In addition to house members, you could form friendships with students from different years or those not affiliated with any particular house. This could include Cho Chang, Luna Lovegood, Terry Boot, or Penelope Clearwater. Shared interests, such as studying together or participating in extracurricular activities, can create bonds that transcend house boundaries.
